_comment: Created by ianb on 04/11/2014 13:01:00 using v2.2
title: How has the number of patients not treated 28 days after a cancelled operation changed?
analysis_commentary: The number of patients whose elective operations were cancelled and not treated within 28 days also decreases within the same time period and shows similar seasonal variation. The long term trends indicates a reversal to the historic rises in 2001 â€“ where there was a sharp reduction associated with the introduction of a performance target on this measure in April 2002. The proportions have remained largely stable at or around 4-5% since 2007.
